item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then — to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn." -- T.H. White

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Marion Zimmer Bradley
item.description: "There is no such thing as a true tale. Truth has many faces and the truth is like to the old road to Avalon; it depends on your own will, and your own thoughts, whither the road will take you." -- Marion Zimmer Bradley

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "Remake the world, a little at a time, each in your own corner of the world." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Nobody deserves your tears, but whoever deserves them will not make you cry." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What power would hell have if those imprisoned here would not be able to dream of heaven?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have been unavoidably detained by the world. Expect us when you see us." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Any game plan? Xypher asked Sin. Don't die. I like it. Simple, bold. Impossible. Works for me. Kat scoffed at his sarcasm. What are you bitching about, Xypher? You're already dead. He laughed. You know, for once, it's good to be me." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "The Simi is environmentally sound. Eat everything except for hooves" -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Nick - Psycho-ass? You're bringing psycho-ass back? Zarek - That's Mister Psycho-ass to you, punk." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Bitch please...you haven't seen mean yet." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Liberty," boomed Wednesday, as they walked to the car, "is a bitch who must be bedded on a mattress of corpses." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "You've won the evolutionary lottery: You're a vampire. Let's go to Disneyland!" -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Bill Willingham
item.description: "Baba Yaga: "... What are his powers" Mirror on the wall: "He reads" -- Bill Willingham

item.title: Diana L. add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "God has no religion." -- Mahatma Gandhi
